TEI.teiHeader:
1876 Diary Eliza Baylies Wheaton
TEI-compatible XML markup by Alice Kellogg with corrections by Scott Hamlin, Zephorene Stickney, and Kathryn Tomasek. Kathryn Tomasek Alice Kellogg Scott Hamlin Zephorene Stickney Lauren Kraus Molly White
&ebwdiapubStmt;
From the Marion B. Gebbie Archives and Special Collections at the Madeleine Clark Wallace Library, Wheaton College
&ebwdiaencodingDesc;
2006-06-21 Alice Kellogg Started TEI encoding.
2006-06-23 Alice Kellogg Started TEI encoding. Encoded names and places to 15 September
2006-06-30 Alice Kellogg Finished encoding names and places, finished proofing
2006-07-06 Alice Kellogg Put in key="id" to names with glossary entries
2006-07-06 Lauren KrausMolly White Made 98 spelling changes, added 5 words, added 37 dashes, added 11 spaces, raised 1 item, added 11 new punctuation marks, removed 13 punctuation marks, removed 2 dashes, and added 3 overstrikes.
&ebwdiabackrevisions;

div.p: Lovely day + mild – Mrs Beane + Flo. went to Bos. yesterday F. returng to Wor – + Mrs goes to Dr Monroe for a swelled foot— Mrs. Ben. Briggs here sweeping + cleag
Eve. Sent for Mrs B. to Depot but she did not return
Commun Sab. I went in P.M. Prof. Ed. Payson Thyarg – preached very interesting– I went out in the Eve. to hear him—
Mild as spring– ground at Mr Freeman's bring harrowed— Lovely day Mrs. Beane retd at Eve. Seminy Pupils came in today– Annie E. brought in package
Clear + cold–
Mrs. B. + I rode with Mr. Wild to Danl. Cobbs + Sam. Drapes
P.M. Lucy Howard called + Hather Gregoy
Sloppy muddy day—
P. M. Mrs B. + I drove out in Buggy Evg. I at desk getting read for Boston in the morng.
Rained last night and some this morng. but cleard off–
P.M. Mrs. B + I drove in Buggy around Jewelry Shop– called at Mrs. McCabes — Misses Mellus + Carter called–
Pleasant Mrs B. + I went to Boston— I attended to Bking + vault + came out at noon— Mrs B. stayed + went to Dr Monroe's– she ret&ddotlow; in 5 1/2 train– Mrs Dr Round + Lizzie Wild called–

Cloudy day– sent Mr. Wild to Taunton on my business– I at desk forenoon– Mrs Babbitt called + settled rent +c – Chloe Braman came + spent the day– P.M. She rode with us around Jewelry Shop + Barrows ville — Eve. I recd. a letter from Eugene + M.A.C.

Drizzly almost — + muddy – I went to Chh. this morng. Rev. John Bennett from Eastern Misi preached. Text Matt where 2 or 3 are gatherd in my name +c – Evg – He called to see us– He is from Eng. out laboring at the West + trying to raise money for an Acadey
Mild + muddy till Eve. when it froze up– Plumber from Taunton here to set W. closet jar but cld. not– I sent Geo.W.W. to Boston to get ond but cld. not– Eve. Mrs Metcalf in–
Cold + very windy last night–
Plumbers here again today to look at W. closet
Briggs drove Mrs. B. + I to Cons–
P.M. Mrs Boynton here cutting garments for Con's folks— Eve. a socialb at Miss Carter's– we at home.
Pleasant. I called at Mrs. Tripps in foren– Have accepted an offer for Hotel + P.O. Lot– + recd. $500. as last payt— Mrs C.W. Allen came in 3 Train–
Eve. A Doz. or more ladies came to sew for Con's family– Mr Wild went to Mansfield P.M.
Clear + cold– We took Mr Wild to Lane's Station for Providenc to get blk. walnut for Bath room + hard pine for new stais I drove back–
Milder towards noon– Mrs Allen left in mid train Mrs Beane went in same train to Dr Monroe's—
Mr Wild took Bath room marble out + basin —
Miss M.B. Briggs called–
Eve. a great gathering at Geo. White's new house.
Very lovely day– I mended my wash in the morng.
P.M. wrote Mr Emerson– A Miss Diane called with books to sell— After my nap I walkd to Harry Crane's grounds,
Cow Lily sick–
Mr Matthews preahd a young + interesting man – Text– Sunday morn on the spirt Coming— I went out in Eve. a large number present—
Drizzly day + I did not get out– Geo. went to Bos. in mid train + Saw Murry about Mason — Eve. Mrs. Metcalf came in—
Still drizzly– + I tired– a letter from Br. Judson—
P.M. a good nap after which I walkd in the mud– Met Ema Willis + She came in to see about So. House—
Still mild drizzly + muddy— disagreeable– Have'nt walked to day– at old &account; Mr Wild helpd me–

Windy last night + today– set out to walk in forenoon but wind drew me in –went to Store in forenoon. P.M. Mrs Babbitt here helping Mrs Beane– Ann Emrsn called + stay&ddotlow; to tea after walking with me– Mrs Metcalf in at Eve.
Frozen up + cooler– I walkd 3/4 in forenoon– Plumbers here + Jams Wrigly in bathroom–
I made info Trustee &account;
P.M. Geo ast&ddotlow; me at dusk on Farm &account; + rep BR—
Pleast day I took two walk Mrs B. went to Boston + back at 3 train– then we went to Cons with garments– Mr Rogerson called in mrg

Drizzly day— snow enough to cover the ground. I went to Chh.morng. + P.M.– Mr. Osborn preach Interesting– new subject. The rightus are like the Palm tree – P.M. go wash today in my Vn&draise; He took tea with us + then had meetg at Smy – Mrs B out I wrote—
I am tired by going to Chh. twice– yesterday–
I sent Geo.W.W to Taunton to Mr Bassett about investing funds
Evg. Dra Blandin + Ed. Freeman in with Mrs Beane about S.S. Books Eve. I drafted Deed for Mansion House

Cold + clear – I walkd to Tim. Smith's + back– about 4 walkd with Mrs Beane in lots + Lane – Eve. at 8 went to Bd. House to sociable for 1 hour came home very tired — Mabel Babbitt here to Engr Deed – of Man. H.
Still cold + windy I feel the worse for my last nights Experinc – Mrs Briggs here sweepig
I dilvrd my Deed of Mansion House to Mr Rogers
G.W.W. is laid up with boils —
Mr Rogerson calld in the morng. to clos up the sale of Hotel. — G.W. Wild was here + afterward assisted me about Farm + Rep Books— It was icy + I did'nt walk –
P.M. laid down but cld'nt sleep–
Drizzly, icy day— rainy some of the time – Jame Wrigly here– I at desk in forenoon some – I walkd with Mrs B. + got muddy –
a young Mother calld with her baby to get mony to get to Ea. Taunton – Had lost her purse – also a woman from Attleboro for Hair Switches –
Drizzly but I walked in forenoon – calld at Store about Brooms + to see Mable– She was here in the P.M. 4 hours visitng
Pleasant– Rev. Fred. Reed of East Taunton preachd, I out in the morng Text on Paul being an Ensample — good old fashion sermon — Eve. he preached at Seminry —
Maggy not well –
Mr Emerson came in 3ch Train —
Anie in at Eve
I sat up late to get ready for Boston —
Mr Wild + Mrs Beane went with me to Boston – bot. Butter + Cheese + Stocks – Stayd all day – Wh. Shows an improvement –
Rained last night — This morng cleared off cold + very windy —
— Mr Rogerson calld this morng on Semy. matters
Miss Mellus call&ddotlow; — P.M.I had a long nap –
Very cold — but pleasant —
Dedication of the Chapel at at Lane's Station P..M.–
I out morning + Eve for a walk Mrs B. + I calld at Mrs Rogerson
I walked out in morng. + P.M. Mabel here to write– also Ellen R. + Emily Titus her cutting out work
Pleasant – Alfred S. Tubbs came at noon — P.M. We went out sleigh ridg — Eve. Arthur Abin + Sarah Round + Geo. + Mary Wild in to tea –
A letter from Wil&ddotlow; —
Pleasant forenoon – I went out with Alfred + Mrs B. Rev Sorino Dwight Clarke preachd Text– She hath done what she could — P.M. I stai'd at home – Snow melting vry fast – Maggy out to sleigh rid —
Icy – Mrs B. + I rode to Depot with Alfred + to Bridgts + then drove ar Jewelry Shop
After nap P.M. I went to walk in lots —
Lovely day – We drove in forenoon
P.M– Saving done here for Home Miss —
Eve. Mrs Metcalf in —
Geo. + Silas Cobb went to Gilbert Lot
P.M. We went into Seminay Hall to hear Miss Blair lecture on the Vatican – after that Mrs B + I drove Blky was dreadfully dull

Pleasant tolerably – some snow fell last night + walk ing "nasty" — I sent Mr Wild to Dr Blake with document to sign also to do some Erand I walk&ddotlow; in forenon P.M. Mrs Babbitt in – I got tired – Eve wrote Mr Hory.

Storm of rain — I expected sister Ema but she did not come – Recd. a letter from Will&draise; in wh. he speaks of sister's memory– She seems loosing it. Alfred came at Eveg. and went to Clayter reception —
Pleasant – Lovely day – Alfred + I drove out for Mosy Sister Ema came at noon
Alfred ret&ddotlow; to Canl at P.M. train –
We had a Mr Harawood to preah – Transfiguration of Christ – an orignal + interesting preacher
Sister Ema here –
Rainy day —
Mr Harry came to work on stairs Eve. a letter from May Seagrar about Sister Mary — she seems failing — My heart is very heavy —
Stormy still – + Sister Ema here — James + Mr Harry here on stairs—

It has cleared + I left home for Ux. with Maggie in 11–20 train — Sister Ema. left the same time for her Home – I reachd – Ux. in 3–10– Found my Sistr glad to see me but would'nt know if I went of the room that I had been ther–
Spent the day at Ux. Walkd forenoon + P.M. Saw Dr Robbins + talked with him about Siste – He thinks she will not be better –
Left for home in 11 Express – via Provd. with Maggie – reach&ddotlow; home at 5 1/2 train with a sad heart
Pleasant — I feel tired — James W. still here on stairs
P.M. had a long nap – then rode to Harry Freeman – Then walkd with Carl in lane – Eve. Arthur Round call&ddotlow; —
Prof. Thuring prchd I out P.M. + Ev. P.M. text Thom. as belief Eve. Blue Lantern —
I walkd nearly to Harry Crane's Eve. Mrs Metcalf in –
J. Wrigley still on stairs
Snowd in the morng Early – but not enough for sleighing

Paths open&ddotlow; and towards night I walk&ddotlow; from our S. House to Benj. Briggs Mrs Tripp + Miss Mellus call'd to see me – Mrs B. went to Mrs Freemans to Miss Sewing – J. Wrigly still on stairs

Raw + very Chilly. A perfect March day — I walk&ddotlow; – 3/4 hour in forenoon Recd. a very sad letter from Will&ddotlow; Poor Sister Mary! She is failing – Recd. a letter from Sis. Ema. J.W. still on star work –
Very cold —
I call&ddotlow; at Geo's – He is confind to the house from Cold — I then walk
Jame here in P.M. to work—
Cold — I walk&ddotlow; to Bridge with Carl in P.M. + walk&ddotlow; in Morng
Jame here late in forenoon–
Lizzie Arnold + Alice Round call&ddotlow;
Pleasant day Jame here on repairs – I call&ddotlow; on Mrs Tripp in forenoon – Then to Geo.'s —
P.M. busy till nap time – after wh. rode with Mrs. Bean + Briggs. Then walkd to Mr Hagerty's – a letter from Mary S. My dear sister failing but calm —
Beautiful forenoon– P.M. cloudy – Prof Thyiorg preach&ddotlow; Morng. text 1 Saml.4"13" –Ele's care for the ark – he read first the 3dc of Danl. with great effect
James + Hagerty both here – Mr Wild got up tho. still feeble —
George came up again today but seems sick + P.M. went to bed for good — Briggs + Maggie cleaned Wash Room
Hagerty + Jame here
Charlie Lane came in forenoon + settled meat bill +c —
James Wrigley here in fornoon only – putting up closet in attic –
I walked out P.M. + saw Mrs Hagerty Her Husband sick George quite sick pain in Ear + head
Mr Hagerty + James both away —
Benj. Briggs helpd us move down stores to new store rooms – in fornoon — P.M. he drove me to Depot to pay Frght.
Geo. still suffering with pain —
Hagerty still away – James here — + put Refrigerator in place – Picked up cellar way + moved shelves in cellar–
I out overseeing Mah, Maggie washd in morng. P.M. Briggs cleaned tin — I calld at Lizzies – at .P.O. + Mr Rogerson store – to talk with him Eve. Mrs Beane went to Semy. meeting —
Pleasant – Fred. Wheaton dowd here yesterday P.M. about note– D. Holman + wife came + dind with us. —
After my nap Mrs B. + drov out – Eve Mail letter from Cyn + May S. Sister M. is failing –
Lovely day overheard – Muddy — Rev. C.H. Bulkly preach&draise; Morng. text on choosing whom you will Serve. P.M. Com. Season – Interesting –
Eve. Meeting at Smy. I Expect to leave in the morng for Ux
Went to Ux via Prov&draise; – to see Sis. Mary Found her very feeble – she knew me –
Eve Sister had a fall —
Sister more helplss Sat up but little but came to table + I fed her –
Fail&ddotlow; a good deal since yesterday
Jerry Kingsburry came
I left the precious sister at 8-20 for Home
Sister Margaret cam at noon –
Pleasant –
I calld at Mrs Tripps — also at George's – He is sick still
Mrs Beane went to Foxboro. to see Ema. Sherman – She is insan – I took Mrs B. to depot + then Sis. Marg&tdotlow; + I rode —
Mrs Bean went to Boston for me – Eve she went to Geo. Sweets to a surprise
Eve. Mind a Sad letter came from Ux about my sist – She is failing fast –
We had Rev. Danl. Noys to preach I went out morg. His text Luk 14 – 26 to 28 verses – on noting Father + Mother + C – good serm
I left home 8–20 for Ux. via Prov reachd hre at 1. Found Sister Mar comfortable tho cold
Sister Mary is losing strength–
I walkd out P.M. after a nap a little way —
Sister failing fast–
Box of towels +c came this noon by Express
Mrs Fisher call&ddotlow; I walkd a little way —
Snowy – so I could'nt walk
Sister Mary very low Mrs Tucker here for the night
Mrs Seagrave came this morng. Abbie Day staid 10 1/2 to help about Sister who had a bad night — Abbie Thompson very sick last night —
Very cold – Snow on the ground –
Sister May at times suffering from pain nausea + griping tho. She can't tell us — Dr in twice –
Lawson S. is to sleep on N. Parlor Lounge–
We moved Mary from her bed to a cot in parlor for 2 or 3 hours + changd her clothes – Dr in twice – calls her better + says she may rally–
I walk&ddotlow; in P.M. snow on ground Abbie Day is to be alone tonight.
Powerful rain in forenoon + last night — Sister Mary very restless + sleeps but little – Had a poor night last night – Seems failing Mrs Seagrav went home this P.M.
Sister died at 9 o'clock this morng. passing easily away.
Pleasant –
Mrs Tucker here at Will&ddotlow;o Cooking for the funeral friends
P.M. Mary Palm came – I walkd in P.M.
Pleasant – Mrs Salsbury here at Will&ddotlow; preparing for the funeral
Judson, Emma, Margt + Mrs Child came at Eve. train
Funeral of sister at Chh. at 1 P.M. A some snow + then rain –
Eveg. pouring – Judson + Emma went home
Pleasant but a flood at Ux. Center

I very busy doing up things to leave went over to sister grave – then to Mrs Fishers – Mrs Seagr + to the Bank – Then to Cynthia House – + opend windows — + P.M. closed them– Calld at Miss Hayden's I am very tired
Pleasant – sister Margt. left with me also May Palm for our homes – leavg Bro. Will&ddotlow; alone with Housekeeper
I reachd home at 10 1/2 morning.
Very tired
Very tired –
Pleasant — Mrs B. + I went to Boston + did business —
I came home at 3 + Mrs B. at 5 1/2
Seminarists returning —
Geo. W. Wild went to Boston for me —
we rode in forenoon —
Pleasant
Mr Nogs prechd I out in morning Lord, Lord open unto me +e — good + I went at Eve to Semy. He spoke from John 1. chp—
Cloud — P.M. drizzly + Eve. raiy I busy at desk
Mrs Storn Charlotte Wild, Mr Ham + Geo– were here – Evg. Mr Rogerson calld –.
Raind all last night + thro. this day – This P.M. some snow with the rain + hard wind — a howling Eveg —
I been at desk all forenoon nearly–
Evg. Georgy Wild call&draise; Eve. pourig rain + Sleet + high wind —
Very boistrous last night – Mrs Bean slept in dressing room –
I at desk several hours–
Pleasant – Snow disappearing – near drawing car load Mason to Garden
Dr Blake here to dine —
Eve. Arthur call&draise;
Mrs Bean + I went to Boston – Bot a Brussels carpet for her chamber Ret&ddotlow; at 3 P.M.
Found letter from Mr Hayward repeating his offer – 5500. for Chapin Estate — which I do not accept –
Pleasant but windy – Miss Elvira Carver came from Fall River + dined with us. She ret&ddotlow; in the 5 1/2 Train
Mr Wild went to Taunton on Errands for me.
Pleasant – I went out in forenoon to Chh. Rev. Danl. Noys Text was Luke 24=50, 51 very interesting sermon + Hymn precious Mrs Metcalf here at noon to lunch. Mr Noyes to tea–
Wm. Hale of Taunton came in morng. Mrs Beane went to Taunton for the day to Miss OBrien Mrs Babbit cam at 10 morng. + 3 P.M. to fit dress–
Danl. S. Cobb. call&ddotlow; to get mony for society — Rec&ddotlow; offer $6000. for Chapin est. of E.B. Haywad – I acceptd–
G.W.W. went to Boston in morn to find a sutable Buggy for me. I went in 11–24 Train to try one – Did not buy – I telegraph Cyn. at 8 1/2 this morng in Ill. + recd. a reply at Station her at noon!
Sent Mr Wild to N. Bed to Brownell Carriage Depositoy to see Buggies – He ret&ddotlow; at Eve– I am to go down + see them –
State Fast—
We were busy about– Sundry things P.M. meeting of the Chh. + Socity
Jams taking off plaster in my chamber–
Mr Wild + I went to N. Bed. I bot Tap Phaeton of Geo. L Brownell—
Warm
Maggie left in Cars 20 m. or 6 for Webster – Letters from Will&ddotlow; + May —
Rather cloudy fornoon + P.M. snowy I went to Chh. in P.M. Mr Noyes present— after service the Chh. had an adjourn&ddotlow; meeting to see if they would call Mr Noyes– 9 yeas – 1 nay + 4 or 5 blanks —
Pleasant– Masons cam + plasterd my chamb – Mr Wild went to Taunton – in fornoon for spikes — Fred. Sweet here whitewashig Maggy's room—
Mrs Babbitt here at 4 P.M. to try on dress
Pleasant – I packd woolen clothes for summr
Mrs Babbitt in at 1 P.M. to try on Basgem
P.M. Mrs Metcalf calld after tea I calld at Mr Rogersns + Miss Carters–
Pleasant – Left
Left home in 11–24 Train for Prov. Enroute for Ux– wher I ar&ddotlow; in 3–10— Sister Cynthia ard' at 11 in foreoon from the West — She went right to work to begin breaking up house

Pleasant tho. rather cloudy + windy – Geo. W. Hobbs calld with deed from Cyn. + my self to E.B. Hayward for Bro.`Adol' s Estate — We delvrd deed in P.M. to Mr Hayward – I was busy in forenoon in packig up Sister Mary's things – P.M. at the House –
Pleasant – Went to Mrs Farmmnrs – after breakfast then to Cynthia's where I was most fornoon with the Hayward's – Then again in the P.M. awhile after my nap –
Drizzly morng. but cleard before time for Chh. I went in the morng. A minister from Ipswich preach&ddotlow; Sister Cynthia staid at home all day –
Pleasant —
Cynthia sick with cold – I ovr to her house much of the tim–
Had carpet shook –
Rain windy day – Cynth some better –
I at the hous some –
Very disagrebe day —
I did'nt go to the House today – Went down to the string store – Cynthia very busy about packing up for the vist —
Cold + windy – My cold kept me from walkg Went into Mary S. + to Mrs Haywards to adrrse about their carpet–
I work on Sis– Mary's things—
Pleasant frosty morng. but clouded and sprinkled — Mary S. came in + sat. an hour
I have a bad cold
Been to work on my dear Sister's clothing –
Pleasant – My cold was so bad that I decided to pack up + leave for Home wh. I did in 12–23 Train getting home 1/4 of 6. Florence came in 3 train for her vacation –
Showery by spells– I kept indoors – Mrs Beane + Flo. went – A Mr from Maine preached–
My cold still bad
Pleasant but very cold + windy– I at Desk hours – Sent Geo. to Tauton in 3 Train about paper for my room. He did'nt return till some 20 m of 9—
Mrs Briggs he cleanig up for paper hangr in my room–
Ben. helpd
H.H. Guello here paping my chamber —
Geo. + I went to Bos. to buy Blk. Walnut furnitur for my room – I ret&ddotlow; in 5 1/2 train —
Mrs B. + Floren went in 11–20 train to Boston Mrs B. to stay till Monday —
P.M. Mrs Briggs here cleanig dressig room
Mr Wild went to Taunton P.M for flour—
Maggie out till after ten –
Geo. put on border in Dress&gdotlow; Room–
Rev. Mr Rhea preachd–
Comman Seases P.M—
Mrs Dram's child bured Maggie went to funeral—
Warm—
Mrs B. ret&ddotlow; from Boston at noon
Men drew dresser from Depot—
I calld at Ed. Freem in forenoon —
I had furniture changed about to get ready for new in my room —
Warm. – pleasant P.M. we still tossig furniture about –
Mrs B. + Maggie on red carpet—
I calld at Brick + on Miss Babcock– then at Desk
Eve. Mrs Babbit calld –

I left in morng. for Uxbridge via Prov. Ar&ddotlow; at Ux. abut 12 3/4 – Found Sister Margaret there – I went to work after my nap on wht. I left unfinish&draise; of dear Sister Mary's clothes – Margt. left after tea for Whitinvlle.
Very busy looking over letters and papers and burnig quantities of wht. belong&ddotlow; to Henry Ad. + Baylies—
Baylies is the brother Nicholas Baylies – Aunt was my father's executor (Adolphus')–
Henry was the oldest bro.
Left Ux. about 8.20 + reach&ddotlow; hom 10 1/2–
Henry + Nicholas long since dead
Pleasant – Rev. Mr Deane of Sommersett preach&draise; a young man– morng. text one thing thou lackest P.M. one thing is medful– good sermons I went out morng. + P.M.
Went to Bos. with Mrs. Beane – and did several errands, went to Furniture Store — at 1 1/2 left in Worces. cars Enrout for Princeton — Reach&ddotlow; Dea, Howards about 6– arrangd for my board
Left p. 1/4 of 8 and our Home 12–20 noon– tired —
Very busy getting rooms in order – Red Carpet in North Room +c —
Lovely day – I drove to Mansfield with Will&ddotlow; + Cynthia to get old tin rep&ddotlow; Mrs Beane afternoon went to Attleboro to Home Miss Mutry with Misses Mellus + Carter—
Lovely day — Will&ddotlow; + Mrs Bean drov with me to Mansfield for tin—
Mr Tibetts call&ddotlow; to pay rent —
After nap I walk&ddotlow; to Chh. + then call on Miss Briggs at Bdg. House
We went to Chh. in morng. Mr Deane preach&ddotlow; It raind just as the serrce was out – Had Carrig brot. down – Text I thot. on my way +c — I went out again at prayer meeting. Evg.
Pleasant – and warm – I busy about various things — Mr Hary began moving. buildig Blk. Shop —
Geo. went for shings — Will&ddotlow; held forth about my farming operations — +c – Some thunder + rain in Eve about 10. o'clk

Cleard off. Will&ddotlow; left for 8–20 train – I drove out in my new buggy for first time — Carl (my dog) died this morng. from sickness — I have had him nearly 9 years – rode out after tea to look for another but will not take him.
Vry cool — Briggs ret&ddotlow; after bing away by sickness since the 12" – I arose Early to write Rev. C.W. Allen Mr Hale came to look at Chimy Cyn. + I went to Taunton + did business —
Pleasant – went out in morng. + saw Blk Shop – call&ddotlow; at Mrs Babbitts Mrs Rogersons + the Rounds — Then cam Home + went to desk
Eve. Mrs Metcalf + Lizzie in —
I went with Sis. Cynthia to Boston — Did busins + shop&ddotlow; with her — Ret&ddotlow; in 4–35 train – tired but have gaind a great deal of strength—
Pleasant but windy
P.M. drove to Mrs Silas Lincoln's to leav letter — Cyn. + Mrs Beane with me
Staid at home in morng. Went in P.M. + voted to have Mr Dean for a permanent supply—
Mr Barney preached — Mrs Beane Sick I not as well as usual —
Walked up to parsonage + to mail warm —
Decoration Day – cooler then yesterday – call&ddotlow; on Mrs Tibbets – She is vry feeble –
Set Mr Husband to work in Howard St —
I out to office + looking after work in Howard Sreet – Tibbets to work for me –
Wend to Boston Mrs Bean + Mrs Metcalf went with me — I attend to Bank business Savings Banks (Suffolk + Provident Trust – of Savgs – came out at 2 — Bot. Tapesty Carpet for Wildes —
Busy in settling up cash &account; – on assn Returns +c Calld – at Mr Hagerty in forenoon–
Tibbets turfing croquett grounds
after nap drove to Silas Cobbs —
Warm day – Tibbetts in carriage house cleaning – Mrs Ben Brgs help&ddotlow; some —
I finishd "Returns" for assns—
Warm vay till tea time – wind East – Mr Craig preach&ddotlow; Light like that of the just +c in forenoon – Eve. Concert at Seminy –
no entry

Pleasant Mrs Beane went to Boston – back on 3 Train – She saw crazy woman in cars – Lizzie + I drove to Tim Smiths + Bolan's for woman for grandma Wild. Mellus + Carter calld with kitty – Sandy – G.W.W. left in 1–55 train for So. Framingham + Brighton – Eve. Mrs Metcalf call&ddotlow; Pegg Fitzgerald here in forenoon –
Tibbetts began work for this week – is helping on fence at Kelly House –
G.W. Wild ret&ddotlow; this Eve. from Brighton + Boston – Bot Surin + tile –

Tibbetts to work on Howard St. fen Whitewasshg it – I left in Morng. with Geo. Wild Jr. for Bos. There took a carriage + with him drove to Harndale st. to see a Dog Mr Wild had got refusal of– It was brot to the carriage for me to see – I bot him in G.W.W. s
name na Then after some Errands went to West Rox to Br Judson's —
Left the dear frinds at West Rox. for 8 train – Judson cam to City with me – I did shopping – + came out at noon –
Tibbetts whitewashig fence – in Howard St –
Some showers – and at tea time a Sevre thunder storm – Mr Tibbets cleared away at Mrs Tripps grands + then came and cleard up veg. + milk cellar —
Rev. Mr Dean + Lady call&ddotlow; in P.M. but it was when I was lying down – + I did not see them.

Cloudy sultry day – I went to meeting in the morng + staid to Sunday School – the first time for almost 2 years – I do feel grateful for the restoration to health – A Mr Grant preachd text Matt. 16–24
Rainy
Pretty fair day in Nortn but Sis. Cyn. + I went to Boston and had repeated showers – I bot. 2d carpet for the Wildes—

Had graduating class of 5 and Mrs Metcalf and Miss Carter, Mellus, Stanton, Pike, Gilman Tappan
Teachs + Mrs Streeter from Toledo– to Tea– a pleasant visit to us. + I hope to them –
Trustee Meeting to choose Miss Haskell for Principal —
Mr Emerson here to dine –
Miss Haskell came from Providence to see Mrs Metcalf + the School – She has been invited to be Principal of the Seminy — Dr Blake call&ddotlow; also – Mr Gibbs here to tea
Sulty day – I drve out with Mrs Ban in morng. Calld. at Sandra + Annis Lincolns Woodward Springs + David Arnold
We had a pleasns drive–
Mrs John Hunt died this P.M.
I walkd down the Lane –
Still warm – Drove out in morng. with Mrs Metcalf to D. Arnolds for Strwbry– Mrs M. in an unhappy frame of mind about leavg this Semy. She with Mr + Mrs Harrison Misses Haskell + Briggs here to Tea.
Still warm – + I languid – I went to Chh. in morng. A Mr Hill preachd text Psl– 46–4+5 I think It was on the latent power of the Chh. + God's preserving care –
Mrs John Hunt burid to day —
Drizzly kind of day – Mrs Ben Briggs here on windows +c –
Mrs Beane + I drove dr to Arnolds P.M. for Berries – Cliffor also brot some in the Eveg.
Hot weather — Jere. Bassett here on Mrs Bean clock –
P.M. after nap went + lookd at grass –
Fred. Sweet + Blandin here painting –
After tea calld on Miss Griffin + Mrs Richmond with Mrs Beane – a fright about Laby—
Still sultry + hot — I drove to Arnolds for Berries with Mrs Beane took G.W.W to Barrowsville Depot Enroute for Providence–
Clifford brot sne more Berries at noon — a Rev Mr Leforrest calld P.M. to see me about C.D. Lothrop — Showers + thunder Geo. White + Fred Sweet here

Mrs Beane went to Boston + out 3 Train Tr
Mrs Chapin went with me to New Bed in 12–5 train to give up R.R. Certificates – we ret&ddotlow; 1/4 5 train– very tired
Cool till P.M.

I feel rather flimpry painters on Piazza floor – Mrs Ben. Briggs here 5 10/60 hours on Chamb. Windows – I had a long nap P.M. After tea played Croquette – with Mrs Bean + Alfr&ddotlow; Cynth. pickd rose bugs from grape bloss
Lovely morng. rose at 5 – + wrote – very warm day – I drove out in forenoon with Miss Babcock – Music Teacher –
Geo. com&ddotlow; haying yesterday –

div.opener:
47th annivesy of my marriage
Sunday, June 25, 1876.
div.p: Very warm till 4 P.M. when clouds gatherd + there was some wind rain + hail – not sou here but clouds very dark East of us. Dr Blake preach&ddotlow; the bacalaureate Servic Text – Prov. 4#.23d Keep thy heart with all diligence +c – P.M. Act.3–6 — very interesting – I went morng. + P.M. –
Hot day – I busy all day –
Mary Seagrave had a 2d daughter born this morng. 5 1/2 clk– 10 2/16 lbs– At night– 10 1/4 or so Mrs. + Mr Emerson came – Cars broke down wh. delayed them – –
Still hot – I went into Seminy Exam. in forenoon with the Emerson's – but too tired to stay thro. Few person present —
Raind last night but clear + lovely today for Annivry Miss Haskell the Prinicipal Elect came with Dea King — a pleasant day– 5 graduates see last part of Diary –
Rose early + dressd for Boston but threatening weather kept me at Home –
I felt languid heat great – day after day —
Still hot — I went to Boston alone – went to Sub. Treasury for first time to get up to 2d story for 2 years – Did not suffer from it – went to vault + to Boyl. Bank – Met some of the Teachers
Drove out with Miss Carny fr. Bd. House – H. Arnolds about strawberres– to Wood&ddotlow; Springs + home via Lincoln Spr
Noon Flor. + Ellen came –
Very hot last night + this morng. Mr Deane preached – Com. in P.M. – good –
I out twice — Maggie went to meeting
P.M. Mr McCabe + Owen call&ddotlow; with Rosy's child –

div.opener:
92d at No. Piazza + 90&ddotlow;in my chamber–
Monday, July 3, 1876.
div.p: vry hot tho. busy – I drove to Bridget's with the Girls — F. + Ellen
Play&ddotlow; croquette –
Very still for this Centennial Day We could hear cannon all around us – We did not drive on act. of fire crackers —
Playd croquette – Lizzie Wild call&draise;

Still hot – up to 80° in my chamber on rising, with 3 open windows – Mr Alfe Emerson came at noon – Mr + Mrs Chase call&ddotlow; in the P.M. After tea Cyn. F. + Ellen drove with to the Arnolds + Woodard Springs – Eve. Mrs Met Mr + Mrs Harrison Mellus + Carter called—
Brezy morng. but 80d in my Chamber on rising with 3 open windows — Cynthia —
A Miss Wilson from Newton calld to see about Mary Lothrop coming to Seminy– Anna Lothrop was with her at Bd. house – I saw her–
very hot – I went to Taunton S. Bk. + took up Dept– P.M. on &account; BulV. Books +c — Mrs Bean took me to Depot – + I ret&ddotlow; with Mr Payson
Wamest day of season very hot– —
Piazza painted 2d time to day —
I drove for wash at Bridget's—

Very warm morng 83d in my chamber at 7 o'clk this morg. but some breeze sping up so I was comforle at Chh. in forenn – Mr Thom. Richmond preach&draise; One day is with the Lord as a thousand years +c —
About 4 P.M. East wind sprang up cool– fist break in to the heat for 2 weeks –
very hot again
I went to Boston with Florence went to Equitable Vault + took on also Saw Merchnts Dispatch Agt. about Cynthia's freight –
Powerful rain thunder + lightning as we came hom in 2 Train
I took Mabl to Depot with Nellie Bean – then took Flo. when I came back – after that Miss Susan Hodges – + drove around Barrowsville —
Hot– Hot—! It seems as if the haymakers would give up
Flo. + Ellen left in 10–10 Train for Julia Rogersn + Ema Shermans
Mrs Metcalf Miss Stanton + Pike call at Eve–
Very hot last night – but little sleeping –
I drove for M.A.C. to Depot at 10.35 but in vain – Mrs B. went again at 3–P.M.
Floren Ellen ret&ddotlow; at Eve –
More comfortabl Cynthia ret&ddotlow; from Judson's this noon —
I am not feeling as well as usual
About 86 &draise; + busy – Went to Chh. in the morng. Mr Keyser of Fall Riv preached – Text awake thou that sleepest–" good serm
I feel very stupid–
Clear + lovely – but dry + bright sun – Geo. has done the last mowing with mower for first crop – I drove to Bridgets' + Depot with Floren + Ellen
Mrs B. + Daghts went to Lenas Carptr with Blky. + Pheaton ret&ddotlow; about 7 1/2 Eve – Mrs Met. calld— also Miss Mellus + Carter –
80° in my Chambr this morng. – Breezy in forenoon – a letter this morng. from Mary A Chapn
Eve. I calld on Mrs Metcalf after her return from Newton Arthur Round calld on the Girls Flo. + Ellen –
The 5th day when the Ther. has gone to 98°– Florene + Nellie Staled this morng. to take 6–27 Train Enroute for Lowell + Haverhill on Bos. Com. + Montreal R.R— I suppose —
Rev. Mr Emerson here and Bd. House about Bath Rooms
Still very hot–
Eve. appearance of a shower – Lightendall over the Heavens –

div.opener:
not so warm quite
Friday, July 21, 1876.
div.p: Rose early + drove to Depot for Mary Chapin but no Mary appear&ddotlow; But Mr Payson brot. her from the 8.20 train via Fall Riv Steamer – to our great joy—
After tea croquete a little then calld on Mrs Ang. Arnold
Mary Chapin came to day—
Cooler – Ther. down to 67° at 7 o'clk–
I took a sever cold last Eve –
Beautiful rain with thunder + lightning — began Early this morng. + continued Thro. the day nearly – I coughd much last night — Mr Deane preach&ddotlow; I at home well nigh sick –
I coughd much last night –
My medicine does'nt do me good–
Cool – sent for Dround's + am laking Medicin Drove out in forenoon to Winncaut with M.A. Chapin Felt better for it.
Miss Mellus had Hors + Pharhan at 3 P.M. – took Miss Carter + Lucy
Still cool – out in sun 1 1/2 hours fornoon– Found worms on the fruit trees
Mrs Briggs here washing a great wash – –
Dr Round calld after tea –
Mrs Bean Mary + I went to Boston I changed my vault to Equit. Safe vault – Bot. M.A.C. a gold watch + pin — went to Miller's boot store –
Mrs Briggs here forenoon ironing —
My cold better –
Cool + lovely –
Mrs Bean so hoars she cld. nt speak aloud on rising –
My cold better– a good night's sleep
A letter from Will&ddotlow; + Austin –
Some warmer Mrs Bean sick from cold – Som milder – hotter I took Miss Mellus to Depot – morng– then drove to Cuntry with Cynthia + May – Miss Carter here to din
I went to Chh. in morng. A Baptist frm Fall Riv preachd — Break up the fallen ground +c –
Mrs Bean sick with cold – Dr Round came for last time – She was worse in P.M.
Began to rain in PM – + rand thr the night –
Rained thru last night + forenoon Mrs Briggs washd Mrs B. a sick night Dr her today —
I settled with the Men –
I lescpd up butter
Geo. W. Wild I sent to New Bed&ddotlow; to collect R.R. dues for 83 shar + interest – Cynthia + Mary went this morng. to Mrs Nat. Freeman's–
Mrs Beane seemd to gain + P.M. foldd my dresses for packing –
Pleasant. Mrs Ben had a poor night + is worse
Cyn. Mary + I went to Bos. Invest funds in Gov &tdotlow; Bonds I ret&ddotlow; in 2 Train
Mrs Metcalf reter&ddotlow; to day–
Mrs B still worse —
Pleasant – Mrs B. some relievd by hot cloths dipd in water put on head – –
Miss Mellus + Carter left to– day for Dorchester
Mrs B. very sick last night – This morng. Early she had a gatherg brak in her head + is relievd– Mrs Metcalf her to dinnr +
Jersey calf turnd out to day — Floren came this Eve at 7 —
90d vry hot day Mrs Bean still vy sick – Mrs Metcalf takes her meals here – I drove out to Mrs Knowles + elsewhere –
Ema Lane died this P.M.
Nellie Bean ar&ddotlow; at 7 Eve —
Vry hot – Mrs Bean we hop is better tho. still a very sick warns I went to Chh. this morng. Mr Payson preachd Blessed are those who have not seen + yet belive +c"
Good performn – I went for Mary C. with Carrige at noon
Pleasant but vry hot Mrs Bean still quit sick – Mrs Briggs here washing –
I had churig done this morng. Rode to Cyn's + took hay to ride – after tea we croquetted – Miss Carry + Mrs Met caod
Not quite so hot —

Mrs Briggs here ironing. I rose Early + workd over Butter Fornoon rode to Cyns + took Mary to Dal. Cobbs – Flor. also went with me – P.M. 1/4 4 Mr Emeson cald I then went Danl. Cobbs again – May + Mrs Metcalf here to Tea — Mrs Bean had a painful time last nigh

Cooler – Mrs Bean had a painful night gathig broke in her Ear – Geo. went to Bos. to buy drain pipe I took him down + Mrs Tripp up to Tim's Cyn. calld + I carried her up to Mrs Freemns. Dr in to see Mrs Beane + left Arradye
Hot – Mrs Bean had a distressd time last night + this morng. from resting powder – I sent at 5 for Dr Round in haste – She was better thro. the day – I drove to Cynthias May cam her to dinner –
Eve Miss Mellus + C. came –
Quite hot – Mrs B w very sevre headache–
I drove to Cyn's + P.O. at desk several hours
Had letter from Mr Howard sayig he let my room –
Hot – MissesMellus + Carter drove Blky after wh. I went to see Cynthia + M. Mrs Bean better
Still hot – No morg. service – But Maggie had one – I went to Chh. P.M. + head the Methodist from Lane's Station –
Vry hot + sultry – 80° in my chambr on rising – Mrs Bean better – Florenc went to Taunton for her Mother –. I rode after taking her to Depot to Mr Truers with M. A. Chapin— M. hre to dinnr—
Rose Early Miss Tozer was sent for to sew for Mrs Beane– Very warm —
Thunder Storm in P.M.
Mrs Bean not so well– Floren + Nel went to Boston + back in 5 1/2 train I took Miss Tozer home Fannie Clopps + family came to George's this morng.
Mrs Metcalf ret&ddotlow; in forenoon – I went to Station + telegraph&ddotlow; Mr Howad that I relinquish my room – then call&ddotlow; on the Wild, Friend, Clopps – Rainy P.M—

Pleasant – Cyn. + Mary call&ddotlow; + I took them to drive to Miss Tozers– Maggie left for her vacation this P.M. 1 1/2– We hav food from Mrs Boyntons – Mrs Beane still very feeble – Mrs Metcalf call&ddotlow; Dr R. in twice –
Mrs Bean better – It is warm –

P.M. I drove with Cyn + Mary
Florenc to the Miss Tozers – am returng go Cyn's wash from Mrs Briggs + then took Cyn. to ride thro. the neck – I am feeble
We all staid at Home – feeble —
The Methodist Minister preachd in the P.M. at our Chh. Mrs Bean better a strong wind commen&ddotlow; blowing in the P.M. + a great chag in the weather to cool –
Very cool – Fair – I took Cyn. + May to Depot for Taunton + sent for them – May had 4 teeth out –
Mrs Ben. Briggs came at noon + help me about housekeeping housekp while Maggie is awy– We had diner sent in by Mrs Boynton for last meal –
Lovely day – I tooke Mrs Bean out to ride for the first time – for nearly 4 wks She is better – Saw May + Cynthia – both feeble from yesterdays work at Dentist's —
Mrs Briggs here –
Pleasant day – Mrs Bean drove with me to Bridget, + then M. A. Chapin to Lane's – Charly's Baby died last night – Mrs Briggs here – Did my washing – + work – We croquetted after tea–
Misses M. + Carter call&draise; –
Milder –
Mrs Bean rode with me to Cyn. Sweets for Butter – M.A.C. here to din Cyn. call&ddotlow; –
P.M. May + Alice had Blky + Phaeton for Buggydrive to Mansfield
Mrs Briggs here
very sultry All of us feeling flimsay Mrs Bean headachy She drove out a little way – –
Mrs Briggs here—
P.M. drove to Bridget's + distributed washing.
Som cooler — Mrs Briggs ISa came to day
Mrs Bean drv out this mornig.
I made pies –
Florence left for Worcester at 1 1/2— vacation over –
Pleasant –
I went out in morng. Mr Dean present with his bride — His text Ex 17–11 Aaron + Hur stay up Moses hands — His first sermon –
Cool + lovely —
Rose Early — Lssy Briggs her without Mother – Mrs B. drove with Mary to Bridgets
Mrs Metcalf returned this noon – Geo. went to Taunton
Cool + lovely —
Mrs Metcalf pass&ddotlow; last night with us. I drove with Mrs Bean + Nellie to C. Sweet's for Butter + them brot Cynthia + Mary back to stop till they leave for good —
Mrs Chapin + May + Mrs Metcalf went to Boston –
Geo. + Lizzie to Taunton – Mrs Briggs + Issy here – C Churnd by Briggs –
After nap went down the fields with Issy Briggs
Work&ddotlow; over Butter and did Sundry things–
Mrs Metcalf + Nellie went to Taunton Mary took them down + went for Nellie – We had roast chicken for dinn– Mrs Briggs here – Issy came at tea time
Very hot –
I settled with George –
Geo. went to Prov&draise; with his Mary – + Fanie + Russell Clapp Enroute for Newark
Profuse rain in the morng. Sent carriage for Mrs Briggs — to get our Breakfast — Libby came at noon – Dr Nutting + Wife her to dine –
Lovely day –
I feeble + only went out in P.M. to Communion– Mr Dean present – He took stand with the Deacons not to have wine passd to the communcants— Dra. Draper withdrew when the cup was passd –
Mrs Briggs here in morng.
Lovely day – Maggie cam in 10–20 Train Mrs Briggs here till noon – when she left after 12 days service– Mrs B. + I drove to Bridgets + Miss Griffins + Eliza Wheels – Lizzie Wild sick.
Cool day Mary went to Taunton at noon to Dentist – + ret&ddotlow; in 7–20 Train –
I drove out in morng. with Mrs B. + Nellie – Then Geo. drove Blky to C. Whites for yoke of oxen to work —
Miss Griffin cam at Eve to Mr Wild's

Still pleasant – I took Mrs Beane + Mary to Depot for Taunton – Mrs for 10–15 – Mrs B. returnd in 11–20 + Mary at 1/4 of 5 – I drove with Nellie to Crane Depot crossing + hom that way – Mrs Loring Willy died Suddenly this morng. Pupils coming in to day – Terne comming tomorrow
I went to Boston in morng, + back at noon — Went to my vault + lookd over S. Bk. Book. +c also to Boylston Bk.
Mary A. Chapin went to Taunton in noon Train for 3d day havig teeth filld – Bro. Will&ddotlow; came at Eve. from Salem – We were glad to see him – Misses Stanton + Pike call&ddotlow; at Eve –

Cloudy morng. + rain&ddotlow; about 10, oclk. Morng for an hour or so. I drove to Bridget's for night dress – with Bro. Will&ddotlow; – Nellie left for good at 1 1/2 P.M. via Worcester – M.A.C. went to Mansfield with Alice + back – It has rain&draise; this P.M–
Bro. Willd. left in morng. train for Home — We did not drive out – Geo. went to Taunton PM to get Funnel +c for draining vinegar –
after nap I call&ddotlow; on Miss Haskill –
Pleasant but cool – I went to morng. Servic – Mr Dean's text in Matt. "as it was in the days of Noc +c" — M.A.C. went with me –
Went to Boston in Early train out at 3 – about Mans writs
Sis.. Cyn. left with M.A.C for Ux. at 11 —
Trustes met at Semy – —
went P.M. to Char. Wilds
To Bos. again Early + out at non with Ellen Rogers + Mrs Beane
Vry busy till 1 1/2 when we turn&ddotlow; keys on the dear old home + with Maggie left for our vacation –
Maggie for Webster + Mrs Bean + I Enroute for Saratoga via Worcester when we arr&ddotlow; at 5 stopping at Bay State – Florence soon came + took tea with us.
Pleasant – at 5m. of 10 we took the Express train for Saratoga via Albany we had a pleasant journy— Reachd S. at 5 1/2 + Dr Strong's Rural Institute at 6 – Found a good room but cold –
Fani Bachelder of Whitens ville is here
a rainy day + we kept in doors —
We chang&ddotlow; rooms + have now the pleasantest in the House – thro Miss Fani Bachelder suggestion –

Pleasant morng. hot + we went to Cong. Spring + in search of verly water — + made some purchases soon after returng to our Rooms it began to rain and a vast quantity of water fell – Miss Bachelder came to our Room — Eve. in our Room by ourselves –
Raind last night but cleard long Enoug for us to go to the street on Errands when it rain&ddotlow; again for 2 or 3 hours – We are rather homesick
P.M. we walk&ddotlow; to Empire Spring
Eve. Fan. B. calld in to see us
Cloudy + a trifle sprinkling – We walk&ddotlow; mong + P.M– I found my first globe at P.O I am getting rested + growing strong

Eve Fani B. came in + playd
Backgammon Bkgam
Cloudy still –
Walkd with Mrs B. to P.O. + spring + Park P.M. we walkd with a Mrs Kapp to High Rock Spring —
Pleasant – Setted Board bill and bal&ddotlow; cash Book – at 11 went to walk with Mrs Beane –

Rainy morng — but rain ceased so as we went to Chh. to hear Rev. Mr Sawyer Pastor of 1rst Methodist Chh. – I had headache in P.M. – + all night when awake – Mrs Bea went at Eve. With Mrs Kapp to hear Dr Geo. B. Chun

Lovely day a letter from Bro. Will&ddotlow; this morng. I had headache heada
last night + went without my tea– am rather feeble to day – walkd in forenoon with Mrs B. to P.O.–
P.M. after nap walkd out East of us —
Rainy day —
Busy reading Kennelworth by Scott — from Cir. Libray
Rains nearly Evry day —
Sent letter to M.E.Wd. + ck. for her to get her Education – in Normal Art School, probably. –
Finished reading Kennelworth – + the tale comented with Connor Manor —
Mrs B. + I walkd out to Springs – to Cir. Library – + Laundry I got off letter + ck. to George W. Wild Jr + 4 other letters –
I am not feeling well tho. walk&ddotlow; out twice –
Had letter from Mr Wild + ans&ddotlow; it sending cks.

Fair most of the day – tho. showerd about 4 P.M. We went to Dr Strykers Chh. Morng + P.M. His morng. txt "Behold the Man" – on the humanity of Christ – very interesting – Chh. remarkable for acoustic properties – P.M. Com. Season a D.D. from Oregon (Portland) name sounded like Kirk + a D.D. Glasgow I think Cain or something like it – very interesting season by Dr Stryker–
Pleasant morng. rose at 4 1/2 – built fire + laid down again till 6 – Then dressd + 1/4 of 7 + I walkd to P.O. to mail a letter to Lizzie – the House mail having gone –

Pleasant — Mrs B. + I walkd to Red Spring + pom over Brd. way – 1 3/4 ml. I think. P.M. we drove out with Miss Bach. to Excelsion Sp. around Longhbury Lake Glen Michael – to the Champion Geyser + Vicky Springs —
Autumn tints lovely.
I went again to Red Sp. with Mrs B – but now + then a sprinkles —
Eve. with a Mrs Danl. Low + Daughter + Mrs Bean I went to Dr Strykers vestry It was monthly Concert – Dr S spoke of Persia
Cloudy + drizzly I took a littl walk while it held up.
I wrote business letters +c – +then began to read the Abbot by Scott –
Raind a good deal last night — + rainy by spells to day —
I call&ddotlow; after breakfast on Miss Bacheld who is not well to day – Twards noon I walkd nearly 2 mils
Cleard off cooler + windy Mrs B. + I walkd down Carolin St + back Later across over to Bd. way ove 2 miles – without much fatigue –
I had letters– one from Lizzie saying "Grandma Wild is failing + ret&ddotlow; to them –
a rainy or sprinky day – We went to Chrg &tdotlow; Chh. in morg. a poor looking people + but few in Number Pastor sick – Eve we went to Mesh. + heard Dr Stryker the Presbyin preach a solmn sermon.
Pleasant – we walk&ddotlow; in morng. to P.O. + then to Depot to find about N.Y. train –
P.M. we walkd up to Chancellor Walworth's old Home – very modest + going out of repair
Lovely forenoon but clouded thick for P.M. – Four of us walk&ddotlow; this forenoon to Ex. spring 3 mls.
Busy packing to leave in mong

We left Saratoga this morng. for N.Y. + Brooklyn — by R.R The journey was one of the most interesting I ever took down the North Rivr – Frank Holmes met us at Depot in N.Y Found Matty in a pleasant Home –
Pleasant morng. Frank, Willa + Mrs Beane went with me to Greenwood Cemetery – We took carriage + drove around – some of the views ever exceedg fine of N.Y. Bay + the region around –

p.del: Pleasant + cold — I went to Chh. this morng. Mr Deans text Thy Kingdom come –
A full house. Miss Mellus calld about 4 PM—

div.p: At Brooklyn – heard Dr Talmadge in morg and went with the Holmes at Eve – snow storm last night

Very cold – Mr + Mrs Holmes Mrs Bean + myself left at 6 1/4 o,clk – for Jersey Ferry enroute for Philadelph – reaching there about 11– Mattie + I went into the centennial grounds + Mr H. + Mrs went for room – We stop&ddotlow; at Libefried's Cor. of Hutton + 41 st st–

Pleasant but cold – After being in the Main Buildg. awhile I went with Mr Holms to Machinery Hall – Saw Corlile Engine – the winners pumps + a crest many things — Then to Agricul Hall – After that to the Kansas Building – The corn + grain were immense in hight also apply immens in size – I saw in Colorado Dept– a herd of Deer shot by a lady + stuffed by her –

Pleasant – I Enterd the Art Gallery or Memorial Hall but the crowd was so great I came out – + visited the Woman's Pavilion + face in butter – the U.S. Dept– seing envelopes made – the anti Refrigeraton – Monitors +c Then California– Canada Mass. + Michigan State Houses + British Houses wh. was in style of 16&th; century —
Morng. Mrs Bean so ill we were not able to leave – She was sick all night but left in P.M. before be getting to Martha's about 8,o'ck Eve — Tired + glad enugh to get out of Phil. crowd —

Let Brookly at 11 + N.Y – about 1 — a hard ride (poor seats in Drawg R. Car– at Mansfield about 8 + found no Train to take us home – but Mr Wild soon appear&draise; With our carriage – we ar&ddotlow; home at 9,o'clock – after being absent from Sept.14&th; —
Added to my Cold from the coldness of my bed —
The House was not sufficiently warm —
Mrs Boynton began this Eve. to furnish us food
I kept indoor from cold –
Cold worse but hoping I may be able to go to Boston tomorro
Calld Dr Round my cold is so bad –
Lizzie Tubbs + Dughtr came about 1 1/2 PM + staid till 1/4 of 4–
Pleasant –
Mr Wild went to Taunton for corn – Florence Deane marrid to day —
I felt worse this morng. but am feeling better at Eve. – Mrs Briggs here in P.M
Pleasant forenoon Cloudy P.M– Dr Round calld this morn.
After nap Mrs B. calld at Parsage + other places –
I am still kept in house from my cold –
Pleasant —
Took my firt ride after being in the House nearly a week –
Drove to Danl. Cobbs for cranbrries — + Bridgets for the wash —
Calls just befor tea
Pleasant —
rode arund Chartly Cornr + Barrowsville–
P.M. Mattie Brighm Mrs Toby + Daughtr Miss Haskell – Wills calld —
Heard of Bro. Will&ddotlow; sickness this Eve –
Pleasant but cold — I went to Chh. Mr Deans text Thy kingdom come –
Pleasant – forenoon on getting plants – into upper Entry –
P.M. Mrs Briggs here cleanig – – after my nap I walkd to Bassett Lot – + Boynton Lot. Misss Mellus + Carter call&draise; Eve. I at Desk Bro. Will&ddotlow; is better a letter this Eve. says —
Cloudy morng. – Busy at &account; –
Pleasant —
Tim. Smith's ara tea
I out walking
Pleasant –
I calld at Mr Rogerson's to see him about T. Smith + get my papers – also calld on Mrs Tripp + Mr Smith to talk about his financial matters –
Showered a very little in morng. + then cleard off — I calld again on Mr Smith a left a Pass book –
P.M. Mrs B. + Lizzie drove out —
After my nap I was desk
Went to Boston the morng. + out at 2 train – Geo. went in at noon to get Laban cloths
I went to Chh. morng. + P.M. the latter was Communion — I enjoyed it – Mr Deane was Simple + let the service speak

div.opener:
Bessie Pope came to Norton today
Monday, November 6, 1876.
div.p: Let 1/4 of 8 for Lane's Station for Ux. via of Prov. – I dined at 11 and at 11 1/2 took cars for Ux. arv&gdotlow;. there 1/4 of 1 – Found Brother – Will&ddotlow; better then I expected – Heard his grievances – + advised accordingly – tht. he shut up House + go to Hotel + board this winter + Sister Marg &tdotlow; go back to Mrs Dudly's —
Rainy day Election for President — Visited with W. + Marg. as I had opportunity + in P.M went to Mary Seagram + passd an hour –

A very drizzly foggy morng. I left Uxbridge 8–20 for home via Pawtucket – + Mansfield on getting to the latter place found the train was takin off – + I must wait till noon – But I had not waited long – 10 mins. perhaps when Geo. appear&ddotlow; with the carriage so I reach&ddotlow; home at 11 –
Still drizzly — Mrs Beane went to Taunton + home at noon —
P.M. it held up from rain —
I walked before tea –

Briggs + wife Besie + I and Mrs Bea of course were on the watch from midnight to see the needful ones were up in season to get Mrs Beane off for the 6–27 Train – wh. she took for Marlboro Depot N.H. to visit her sister – It was very rainy —
Still rainy — We need it all for the springs are very low — but it is trying to be kept in the house So long Tim. Smith went to board at Millard's
Miss Haskell calld a few minutes before tea —
A sprinkly forenoon so I staid at home P.M. it cleard up so much that I walk&ddotlow; out in the lane –
My home seems lonely without Mrs Beane —
Pleasant – after rny morng. work I went out on 3 or 4 Errands – P.M.—
Mr Wild drove to Taunton Asylum to see about his Mother going there– Poor Woman!–
Drizzly or cloudy — Mrs Metcalf cam in 3 train from Newton + stopd here– She had some 25 callers before Eve was gone —
Tilla Fisher passes the night here with Mrs Metcalf
Some rain – I send some things to vestry for the association — Mrs Metcalf here till P.M. She went to tea to Miss Carter's
Lizzie + Mary Wild calld in –
Pleasant —M
Mrs Metcalf left in 11 Tran I took her to Depot with Miss Mellus. + on returng drove further –
I calld at Mrs Greys + pd. Minister bill at Hotel – for Associatin –
I went to Boston + out in 2 Train – Did a good deal of businss – Met Georgy Wheaton in cars —

Cloudy day – had windows washd by Laban + Mrs Briggs – Double windows put on +c +c – Poor Bessie went to bed at noon sick with violnt cold — 2 letters this Eve from Bro. Will&ddotlow; — about his housekeepig matters

Cloudy but no rain till 4 o'clk or so – I went to Chh. this morng. Mr Dean's text — Eph. 3–17– that C. may dwell in you by faith– He adrd the idea that C. often was in the heart when we knew it not – Not then by faith.
I very busy in looking after housekeeping writing +c – Rainy day + all last night –
Wrote Margt (Sister) in P.M—
Eve. windy and lonely – Mrs Bean returns tomorrow
Still rainy – It was a stormy night last night —
I had a little Buter 2 or 3lbs stirrd up
Mrs B ret&ddotlow; at noon – to my joy – in the rain
Still raing but more of a drizzle – P.M. Mrs B. + I went to P.O. + nearly to Charly Clapps – with our umbrellas spread —
Eve. Mrs B. cut out Towels – + I sewd —
Bessie put out the clothes but they have done little drying. I busy in forenoon on flowy + sundry things. P.M. with Mr Wild went to see drains in Boyn Lot– Pony lot +
Pleasant day – Geo. went to Bost– in mid train to get drain tile for Bath room Soil pipe —
I took him to Depot – Miss Haskell calld – Eve. I wrote –
Lovely morng. I out doing errands – Mrs Bean mxing Pie meat –
Pleasant Mr Deans text Rom. 7–9– – 3pts 1 Man was sinful 2 he was not consci of it till 3d the com&ddotlow; came to covering of guilt – good – I stop to Sab. S. + went out in the Eve –
Pleasant – I busy making pie crust in fornoon – got vy tire&draise; after nap call&ddotlow; at Mrs Hatfield , whose Mother lays dead – + then at Mr Pratt's at Derry H.
Will&ddotlow; + Margt. came to day — in 3 train —
I made more Pastry in the morng.
Pleasant –
Visited with the friends quietly
P.M. after nap I walk&ddotlow; with Will&ddotlow; nearly to John Crane place
Mr Wild went twice to Depot for Floren but she did not come.
Thanksgiving Day.
Very cold – for the seasn a sudden approach of Winter weathr – I have been at the Desk considerable – This Eve a postal saying cousin May Bayles is dead –
Cold + – clear – Foren drove with Will&ddotlow; + Marg &tdotlow; to Lanes – P.M. Will&ddotlow; went to John Cargills – I walk&draise; at dusk –
Eve. Georgia call&draise;
Pleasant – We all went to Chh —
Also at Eve Monthh cont—

Will&ddotlow; + Marg &tdotlow; left in 1rst train – I ve had a pleasant visit from them. I had crick in hip + kept indors Lizzie Wrigly Foster was buried to day – here also the funral of Cousin May B–
Cousin Lovely day – Mrs B. + I drove out to Lenas Carpters in P.M. Forenoon I walk&ddotlow; out on Errands + Eve. at 8 1/4 went Miss Carters sociabl vry pleasant tim–
Went to Taunton at 1/4 9 + back at noon –
Went to Boston with Mrs Bean + I ret&ddotlow; at 3 – Mrs B. at 5 1/2 —
Pleasant – Did Sundry things – + went to Mrs Boynton's to try butter –
P.M. to Miss Haskell's to pay Mary Lothrop bills – then walkd with Miss Briggs to Eliza Wheelers + to cottage —
Snow Storm in the mornig – Bessie the cook went to Bos. + back at Eve– The snow ceasd + it grew very cold + windy I did not go out doors —

vry cold – Last night was a fearful wind + vry cold Have been to Chh. Mr Dea Text in 1rs Romans – 19+20 verses –good – I was in S.S. had little girls to day – Eve We went to Christmas concert – good The School closes in a day or two (the Seminary I mean – Hav just been writing Austn —

7°a.0 Still very cold but moderated thro the day to 14° – Snowd some but too cold to do much that way – Rev A. Emersn came at 3 1/4 P.M. to attend Trustee meeting tomorrow – He preachd at Middleboro —
Still tEdious + trying to Snow – Bessie wash&ddotlow; + hung clothes in chamber –
Trustee Meetng + Semy Closed for Fall Term —
Mr Emerson went home in 1/4 of 5 Train –
Eve. we went into Miss Carters
Pleasant – Snow melted a good deal – Mrs B. + I went to Bos I came at 3 P.M
Hazy sloppy day – Mr Wild wnt to Mason's with hay –
Mrs B. + I rode in P.M. to Chartly corner –
Eve. Mr Deane calld + Mrs Wild
Mrs B. + I workd on drawers –
Helen R. Rogersn gave birth to a son last night –
P.M. went to store for galoon +c –
Cold – we went to Chh. Mr Dean tex in Matt the light that is in thee be darken how great +c – good I had little girls class in S.S.
Moderated so as to snow Some then rain + just before night lightng + thunder – one clap. I wrote three letters
Pleasant – bright day – tho. I have not been out — was busy on Wipers + mending in forenn + P.M. after nap Eugene Chapin came –
Lovely winter day Eugene left in 11 Train –
P.M. I walk&ddotlow; with Mrs Bean
Mrs B. + I went to Boston + staid all day — It snowd several hours. I have gaind in strength — but came home with head ache –

Cloudy but lovely day + sleighing perfect — Geo. + Briggs in woods cutting white oak – for fence posts – P.M. I went out + walkd with little Call nearly 2 hours – Mrs Metcalf came at 5 P.M. Had been to Taunton to see about Ema Lothrop
Pleasant day – a good deal of snow fell last night – Mrs Metcalf ret&ddotlow; to Newton at 11 Train — P.M. I was out calling + walking nearly 2 hours —
Ev. Alice Round call&ddotlow; with some eggs for me — Geo. went to Taunton + bot. corn–

Coldest by my Ther. of the season – I presum by othe Ther's it was 5 or 6 below – Mrs B. + I went to Chh. Mr Dean's text in Luk 2– glad tiding to the sheps – I staid to Sab. Sch. MissesMellus + Carter calld + staid to Tea –
Pleasant tho. cloudy no storm – moderated – Mrs B. + I went by invitation to cottage to dine on goose – Met the Paysons + Mrs Metcalf Eve. we went to Xmas tree at the vestry –
I was very busy getting packages off to vestry + friends –
Snow a little all day – Mrs Metcalf + Collagues here to dine –
Floren came at noon – P.M. we went to sleigh riding – Miss Mellus her to din + tea with olin Lane.
Mrs B. + Flo. drove to Lenas Carpenters. I walkd—
Eve. we went to vestry meeting
Storm began about noon after I walk&draise; violent snow storm + then rain + Small hail – Then wind – Ev. Geogy Wild in + we had game of letters –
Sun shine – windy – + Icy from frozen snow Miss Mellus exchgd myher Xmas gift to me card receive–
P.M. walkd with Floren around Cath. Chh. + Cons. neck woods home
Lovely winter day – we went to Chh. Mr D.'s text The Heart is past +c – a solmn sermon
Miss. Herald to 1880 inches Home Guard. pd. for to Jamy 1878 Life + Light to Jany 1880 — Pd. for Box P.O. to July/ 77

text.back:
Memoranda
Benj Sweet 6th Jany Benj. Sweet died on the 6" Jany.
Sister Mary March 22 7, o'clk morng.March 22d at 7. o'clk in the morng. My dear sister Mary fell asleep in Jesus – Had she lived to the 30&th; of June she would have been 73 years of age. She died of paralys Her right side She could not move at all – She had been failing for some months but attended to her family duties till into Feb. tho her mind began to fail in Jany.
or first of Feb. I went up to see 16&th; Feb. and then on the 7&th; of Mar. staying 2 nights – There again on 13&th; of March — beig with her some 10 days when she died – a privelege I can ner be grateful Enough for – Abba Thompn came as Housekep + day nurs + Abbe Day a night watcher – Every thing was done that could be for her comfort – Lawsn + Mary were very kind – The funerel was on the 25&th; Satr Mr Biscoe attendd it – at the Chh. It was a dreadful snow + rain storm – Judson + Ema went home in it
.Bro. Will&ddotlow; is broken in spirit by the bereavement – His home is desolate –
Mrs John Hunt June 16"June 16" Mrs John Hunt died this P.M. 81 yrs — Had lain some 7 months helples with paralysis
Ema Lane August 5Aug &tdotlow; 5 Ema Lane died this P.M. Suddenly – age 74 –
May Baylies Dec. 1Dec. 1 Have heard of cousin May Baylies death –
Memoranda
May Seagrave Jany 26Jany 26"— May Seagrav born a 2d Daughter – + her 4&th; child – named Mary Judson
Hlln Round Rogerson Dec 15Dec 15– E Hlln Round Rogersn bore a son her first child –
&ebwdiaback;
